alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Union; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:07PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WAYNE, UNION AND SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, PREBLE AND SOUTHWESTERN DARKE COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Liberty, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Connersville, Eaton, Liberty, Camden, Lewisburg, New Paris, West Alexandria, Gratis, West College Corner, Salem, Waterloo, Abington, Brownsville, Eldorado, Verona, West Manchester, College Corner, Spring Grove and Boston. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 151 and 156. I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
